The correct answer is option 2, i.e, Literature.

In 1913, Rabindranath Tagore was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature.

He was born in Calcutta on May 7, 1861.

He was popularly known as Gurudev.

Tagore was knighted by the British King George V in 1915.

Sir Tagore left his knighthood after the Amritsar massacre of 400 Indian protesters by the British soldiers in 1919.

He was also a philosopher and educationist.

He was good friends with Mohandas Gandhi and given him the title of "Mahatma".

His Nobel Prize was stolen in the year 2004 from the safety vault of Visva Bharti University.

He gave the national anthems for two countries, India and Bangladesh.
